BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: GSMA MOBILE FOR DEVELOPMENT FOUNDATION INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE FOUNDATION WAS CREATED FOR THE PURPOSE OF DEVELOPING & ENGAGING IN PROJECTS THAT UTILIZE MOBILE COMMUNICATIONS TO RELIEVE THE POOR, DISTRESSED, AND UNDERPRIVILEGED.
IRS990.MissionDesc: GSMA MOBILE FOR DEVELOPMENT FOUNDATION, INC WAS CREATED FOR THE PURPOSE OF DEVELOPING AND ENGAGING IN PROJECTS THAT UTILIZE MOBILE COMMUNICATIONS TO RELIEVE THE POOR, THE DISTRESSED, AND THE UNDER-PRIVILEGED.
IRS990.Desc: Ecosystem Accelerator : Our mission is to build synergies between start-ups and mobile operators, with the aim to scale innovative and sustainable mobile services in emerging markets. Despite an increasing number of mobile products and services in emerging markets, reaching scale is still a challenge for most. The GSMA Ecosystem Accelerator works to bridge the gap between operators and innovators, enabling strong partnerships that support the growth of commercially sustainable mobile products and services. By opening the dialogue between innovators and operators, the programme helps operators contribute their assets and expertise to the most promising ideas. This will in turn support innovators to secure the funding and direction they require in order to bring their products and services to scale. In fostering these partnerships, we can bring the most impactful mobile solutions to the people and places that need them most, generating the greatest socio-economic impact.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: M4D Utilities: The Mobile for Development Utilities Programme promotes the use of mobile networks, infrastructure and payment systems to open new pathways for affordable and reliable utility services to reach the underserved. These innovations for service delivery boost industry and economic growth, for example by enabling entrepreneurial phone charging services in remote areas, or reducing water service providers losses from water leakage or uncollected bills.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Mobile Money: Our mission is to support our members and industry stakeholders to increase the utility and sustainability of mobile money services and increase financial inclusion. Two billion people remain unbanked, without access to safe, secure and affordable financial services. The GSMA Mobile Money Programme is working with mobile operators and industry stakeholders to create a robust mobile money ecosystem, which will increase the relevancy and utility of these services, and ensure their sustainability. To truly transform the financial lives of underserved people, mobile money must become a central monetization mechanism, universally available across a greater range of digital transactions. By making mobile money more central to the financial lives of these users, greater financial inclusion, economic empowerment and economic growth can be achieved.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Officers and directors of the foundation have seen and reviewed the GSM Association's determination letter from the IRS that it has been recognized as an organization described by Section 501(C)(6) of the Internal Revenue Code. At the Foundation's request, the GSM Association prepared a pro forma Schedule A, Part III during the taxable year and provided a copy to the Foundation.

THE FOUNDATION HAS IMPLEMENTED A PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PROCESS TO ASSURE THAT THE SUPPORT PROVIDED TO THE GSM ASSOCIATION IS USED ONLY FOR SECTION 170(C)(2)(B) PURPOSES. AS PART OF THAT PROCESS, THERE ARE REGULAR AND CONTINUOUS DISCUSSIONS BETWEEN FOUNDATION PERSONNEL AND THE GSM ASSOCIATION PERSONNEL RESPONSIBLE FOR MANAGING THE CHARITABLE, EDUCATIONAL, AND SCIENTIFIC PROGRAMS CONDUCTED DIRECTLY BY THE GSM ASSOCIATION. THAT REGULAR WORKING RELATIONSHIP WITH THOSE GSMA ASSOCIATION PERSONNEL ALLOWS THE FOUNDATION PERSONNEL TO ASSURE THEMSELVES THAT EACH PROGRAM TO BE SUPPORTED BY THE FOUNDATION EXCLUSIVELY FURTHERS SECTION 170(C)(2)(B) PURPOSES. IN ADDITION, ONCE A PROGRAM HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR FOUNDATION SUPPORT, THE FOUNDATION DISBURSES FUNDS IN A MANNER THAT ASSURES THE PROPER USE OF THOSE FUNDS. EVERY MONTH THE FOUNDATION OBTAINS FROM THE GSM ASSOCIATION A CALCULATION OF THE ACTUAL EXPENSES OF EACH APPROVED PROGRAM INCURRED DURING THE PRECEDING MONTH. AFTER THE FOUNDATION CONFIRMS THE ACCURACY OF THOSE EXPENSES AND THAT THEY WERE PROPERLY ALLOCABLE TO AN APPROVED PROGRAM, THE FOUNDATION RELEASES THAT AMOUNT OF FUNDS TO THE GSMA ASSOCIATION TO REIMBURSE IT FOR THOSE EXPENSES.

AS DESCRIBED IN THE RESPONSE TO SECTION A, LINE 3C, THE FOUNDATION AND THE GSM ASSOCIATION HAVE ESTABLISHED A PROCESS TO ASSURE THAT GRANTS PROVIDED TO THE GSM ASSOCIATION ARE USED ONLY FOR SECTION 170(C)(2)(B) PURPOSES. AS A RESULT, A REQUEST BY THE GSM ASSOCIATION FOR A GRANT TO SUPPORT A PROGRAM OR PROJECT SERVING DIFFERENT PURPOSES WOULD NOT BE HONORED BY THE FOUNDATION. IN ADDITION, THE FOUNDATION HAS AN ESTABLISHED PRACTICE OF RESERVING TWO OR MORE SEATS ON ITS BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR INDEPENDENT DIRECTORS. IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST WERE TO ARISE FROM A GRANT REQUEST MADE BY THE GSMA ASSOCIATION, A COMMITTEE CONSISTING SOLELY OF THOSE INDEPENDENT DIRECTORS WOULD BE THE ULTIMATE ARBITERS OF HOW THE FOUNDATION'S FUNDS WOULD BE USED.
SEE RESPONSE TO PART IV, SECTION A, LINE 3C.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GSMA Mobile for Development Foundation, Inc. develops and engages in projects that advance charitable, educational, literary or scientific purposes, within the meaning of Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code, and is exempt from federal income tax as an Foundation described by Section 501 (c) (3). Specifically, the Foundation was created for the purpose of developing and engaging in projects that utilize mobile communications to relieve the poor, the distressed or the under privileged. The Foundation annually evaluates all federal and state income tax positions. This process includes an analysis of whether these income tax positions the Foundation takes meet the definition of an uncertain tax position under the Income Taxes Topic of the Financial Accounting Standards Codification. In the normal course of business, the Foundation is subject to examination by the federal and state taxing authorities. In general, the Foundation is no longer subject to tax examinations for the tax years ending before March 31, 2015.
UNREALIZED FOREIGN CURENCY TRANSLATION ADJUSTMENTS: (119,695)

The Foundation has implemented a program management process which requires periodic activity reports which detail the program service activities occurring outside of the US, as well as, conducting regular reviews and discussions between the program managers and staff. In addition, each grantor has specific reporting requirements that provide an additional layer of oversight on program service activities that occur outside of the US.
All grantee organizations received payments from the foundation in US dollars and are reported on Schedule F, Parts I and II.

The Foundation has implemented a program management process which requires periodic activity reports which detail the program service activities, as well as conducting regular reviews and discussions between the program managers and staff. Additionally, each grantor has specific reporting requirements that provide an additional layer of oversight on program activities.

THE COMPANY HAS A POLICY THAT FOR ALL BUSINESS TRIPS WHICH INCLUDE A LONG HAUL FLIGHT (DEFINED AS FLIGHT TIME OF 4 HOURS OR LONGER) THE EMPLOYEE WILL BE REIMBURSED FOR A BUSINESS-CLASS TICKET AT THE EMPLOYEE'S OPTION. HE/SHE MAY ELECT TO PURCHASE TWO ECONOMY/COACH CLASS TICKETS AND HAVE THEIR SIGNIFICANT OTHER ACCOMPANY THEM PROVIDED THAT THE COST OF THESE TWO TICKETS ARE LESS THAN THE COMPARABLE BUSINESS CLASS FARE.
AN OFFICER AND A KEY EMPLOYEE OF THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVED NON-FIXED BONUSES, PAID THROUGH A RELATED ORGANIZATION, OF WHICH THERE IS A COMMON PAYMASTER.
LINE 1: BOARD MEMBER OF ORGANIZATION IS AN OFFICER OF DIALOG AXIATA.
Three directors or Officers of the company, David Walsh, Louise Easterbrook and Mats Granryd had a business relationship during the tax year.
The Company is a nonprofit corporation formed under Georgia law. Its sole member is the GSM Association, acting through its United States branch office.
GSM Association, as the sole member of the Foundation, has the power to appoint the Foundation's directors.
The Company's annual operating budget is subject to approval by the Board Members and of the sole member, GSM Association.
THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY SENIOR MEMBERS OF THE MANAGEMENT TEAM.

Directors and officers are required to execute annual written certifications of compliance with the conflict of interest policy. Any exceptions must be disclosed and reviewed by the organization. The directors and officers have certified their compliance with the policy for this tax year.

The sole member's human resources staff performs benchmarking studies to determine all officer compensation packages. These studies utilize external data on each element of the packages including base salary, incentive compensation, and benefit programs. The sole member's company CEO approved the compensations package for the organization's CEO and other officers.

The company maintains public disclosure copies of its governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements at its principal office. These copies are available upon a written or in-person request for access.
